text: hi I'm Kim Severson with the New York
Times in Atlanta Georgia here in front
of miss Anne's snack bar home of the
famous ghetto burger so famous in fact
she put the place on the market for 1.5
million dollars while the economy's kind
of tanked so the prices dropped a
$450,000 but she still thinks it's worth
it and we're gonna find out if that's
true
my name is Anne price but everybody
called me Anne
well I wanted some type of small
business so I was in the area just
looking around for something small and I
came across this but I didn't know for
sure whether the owners wanted to lease
it or sell it so I stopped in one day
and I found out they wanted to lease it
with an option to buy after a year in
1972 may 15th this place is so special
because of the gateau burger well what
happened is I had a customer in here one
day his brother used to always get a
double chili cheeseburger that's all it
was a double chili cheeseburger he
didn't like onions just a double chili
cheeseburger with mayonnaise and ketchup
no lettuce no tomato his brother was
watching him eat the burger and he said
man that's a big burger he said you
should call that burger - ghetto burger
so the name ghetto didn't come from
either the putting it together off the
burger came from me I put bacon lettuce
tomatoes mustard ketchup mayonnaise on
it and I named it get over
hmm
it's a good burger people come here
because of the quality of food not
because of how fast they can get it
I mean you I've seen people wait out
here two and three hours just for one
burger
there's only eight stools in here so I
only want eight people in here at a time
the grill is small so we can only cook
so many burgers you've got to have rules
you're gonna make some people mad then
some people you can get along with it's
businesses like that you won't be able
to get along you're gonna lose a few
customers but you also gain customers
too you can't let a handful of a cut
know good customers run your way there's
nobody like Miss Ann she's loved see
nothing the same does things our own way
you know they see but she's a sweet lady
we all love her
I've been putting in 12 to 13 hours a
day for over 38 years so it's very hard
when you work 13 I was a baby my day
start in 7:30 in the morning they are
some nights I don't get out of here till
nine o'clock what I've learned in 38
years being in business if you want your
own business you got to be willing to
work hard you can't depend on somebody
else you got to be able to do it
yourself to make it work and that's what
I've learned
so what are you gonna do if you get your
half a million dollars on going to
Disney World
I've already decided now this is what I
want to do I want to sleep for a while
